Search

Use the search component to allow a user to enter (a) search term(s) to find specific content.

Installation 

                  
                    npm i @govflanders/vl-ui-search

or 

                  
                    yarn add @govflanders/vl-ui-search

Usage

Import SASS 

                  
                  @import "vl-ui-search/src/scss/search";

Make sure your sass --include-path includes node_modules/@govflanders/.

Search inline

Small and inline search field

      <div class="vl-search vl-search--inline">
    <label class="vl-search__label" for="id-1">
      <span class="vl-u-visually-hidden">Zoekterm</span>
      <i class="vl-vi vl-vi-magnifier" aria-hidden="true"></i>
    </label>
    <input class="vl-input-field vl-search__input" type="search" name="vl-search" id="id-1" value="" title="Zoekterm" required />
    <button class="vl-button vl-search__submit" type="submit">
      <i class="vl-vi vl-vi-magnifier" aria-hidden="true"></i>
      Zoeken
    </button>
  </div>

Search block

Large variant on a light gray background, use the vl-search--block class modifier to stretch the search to the width of the parent container.

      
  <div class="vl-search vl-search--block">
    <label class="vl-search__label" for="id-2">Zoekterm</label>
    <input class="vl-input-field vl-search__input" type="search" name="vl-search" id="id-2" value="" title="Zoekterm" required />
    <button class="vl-button vl-search__submit" type="submit">Zoeken</button>
  </div>

Search alt

Large variant on a white background, add the vl-search--alt class modifier to change the background color to white.

      
  <div class="vl-search vl-search--block vl-search--alt">
    <label class="vl-search__label" for="id-3">Zoekterm</label>
    <input class="vl-input-field vl-search__input" type="search" name="vl-search" id="id-3" value="" title="Zoekterm" required />
    <button class="vl-button vl-search__submit" type="submit">Zoeken</button>
  </div>

Search-combined fields

Adds an extra field next to the search field. Use this extra field to add an extra filter to the search query, for example: a location. Note that the search term(s) in the primary search field remain the primary filter.

      
  <div class="vl-search vl-search--block">
    <label class="vl-search__label" for="id-4">Zoekterm</label>
    <input class="vl-input-field vl-search__input" type="search" name="vl-search" id="id-4" value="" title="Zoekterm" required />
      <label class="vl-search__label" for="select-id-4">Locatie</label>
      <select class="vl-select vl-search__input" name="select" id="select-id-4" title="Locatie">
          <option value="1">Brussel</option>
          <option value="2">Gent</option>
      </select>
    <button class="vl-button vl-search__submit" type="submit">Zoeken</button>
  </div>
